p: The roles of NLR signaling in bacterial infection have been broadly investigated [ 29]. IAV infection activates NLR family pyrin domain containing 3 (NLRP3) and NLR apoptosis inhibitory protein 5 [ 30]. Notably, viral PB1-F2 protein acts as the signal activating the NLRP3 inflammasome [ 31]. Moreover, the IAV M2 ion channel is needed to activate the NLRP3 inflammasome and cleave pro-IL-1Î² and pro-IL-18 [ 32]. Overall, the function of NLR signaling is undisputable and complex. In a recent study, Ichinohe et al. found that NLRP3 inflammasome signaling is involved in the protective adaptive responses to IAV infection [ 33]. Conversely, other studies demonstrated that the NLRP3 signaling has no effect on the adaptive immune response [ 34, 35].
